Articles.Content: For something I'm working on I need a slim 10000 milliamp battery pack that goes to micro USB that is constant power. AKA No need to flip a switch to feed power to it. Plan on hearing about this project further on.

> 
> For something I'm working on I need a slim 10000 milliamp battery pack that goes to micro USB that is constant power. AKA No need to flip a switch to feed power to it. Plan on hearing about this project further on.

As long as you ensure you get a original one, as there are a lot of fakes out there, a [Xiaomi power bank](http://www.mi.com/sg/mipowerbank/) is a cheap and very good option. I am not sure about the power switch, you will need to check that out.

Sadly, the big ones are too big and the small one that would fit in the case doesn't have the amperage.

I have decided to go wired, AKA power supply.
